events.title: Benjamin Franklin's Kite Experiment
events.description: Benjamin Franklin conducted his famous kite experiment, proving that lightning is electrical in nature.
events.significance: This experiment was pivotal in the study of electricity and laid the groundwork for future electrical research.

events.title: Italy Declares War on France and Britain
events.description: During World War II, Italy formally declared war against France and the United Kingdom, joining the Axis powers.
events.significance: This marked Italy's active entry into World War II, expanding the conflict in Europe.

events.title: Alfred Hitchcock's 'The Birds' Premieres
events.description: Alfred Hitchcock's thriller film 'The Birds' premiered in New York City, introducing groundbreaking special effects.
events.significance: The film became a classic of suspense cinema and influenced the horror genre.

events.title: Croatia Declares Independence from Yugoslavia
events.description: Croatia formally declared independence from the Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia, beginning the Croatian War of Independence.
events.significance: This declaration was a major step in the breakup of Yugoslavia and the reshaping of Southeast European borders.

events.title: Death of Katharine Hepburn
events.description: Acclaimed American actress Katharine Hepburn passed away at the age of 96.
events.significance: Hepburn was one of the most celebrated actresses in Hollywood history with a career spanning over six decades.
